description: b-Reflected pro forma tax expense the company would have been required to pay if it had been incorporated on Jan. 1, 1992.Year-ago shares outstanding were based on assumption that partners of predecessor company exchanged their interests for shares of NPM common stock on Jan. 1, 1992.

title: Don't Make Asylum Seekers Hysteria Victims
description: To the Editor:

title: Riggs-U.S. Accord Set
description: The Riggs National Corporation, a troubled Washington, D.C., bank holding company, entered agreements today that will place it under tight supervision by Federal banking regulators.

title: An Old Rivalry Is Retread
description: Goodyear, the tire company that has had the Indianapolis 500 to itself since 1975, will be getting some competition.

title: Icahn Bids $1.18 Billion Cash For Control of Bankrupt E-II
description: Continuing his efforts to acquire E-II Holdings Inc., Carl C. Icahn offered yesterday to pay $1.18 billion in cash for the bankrupt holding company, which owns Culligan water purification systems, Samsonite luggage and the maker of Botany 500 men's suits.

title: Ending the Subsidies For Timber Barons
description: To the Editor:

title: Jackpot Enterprises reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included an extraordinary gain of $ 204,000, or 4 cents a share, in connection with the repurchase of a portion of the company's debentures.

title: Liuski International (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
A King-Size Lawsuit
description: A minority owner of the Sacramento Kings has filed suit against his partner for allegedly misappropriating $22 million in partnership funds.

title: Corrections
description: An article in Science Times on May 4 about rare green icebergs misstated the basis for their color. The icebergs form when blocks break off Antarctic ice shelves and capsize, bringing into view frozen sea water that makes up the bottom part of the iceberg. The frozen sea water has a green appearance -- not yellow -- because it contains dissolved yellowish-brown organic material. Pure ice appears blue, and the presence of the organic material shifts the color to green.

title: INSIDE
description: Clinton Tries to Focus Attention on Economy

title: No Headline
description: "I am Xan Wilson. In the past, I've been known as the condom rape victim. I am not the condom rape victim: I do not have the victim's mentality. I am a survivor of rape, which is a violent crime." -- ELIZABETH XAN WILSON, to jurors in Austin before her attacker was sentenced. [ 6:1. ]

title: Review/Television; The Conquest of the West As the Conquered Saw It
description: What is it about the American Indian that brings out the pretentiousness of documentary makers? "How the West Was Lost," an often moving six-part series told from the point of view of the peoples who were decimated as successive waves of invaders, colonizers and settlers swept across their lands, is marred by arty effects and a determination to present the Indians not just as victims of greed, cruelty and ignorance but also as spiritually superior to their conquerors.

title: Queens Party Leader Urges Stein to Quit Mayoral Race
description: The Queens Democratic Party leader, Representative Thomas J. Manton, endorsed Mayor David N. Dinkins for re-election yesterday and said he had asked his old friend, City Council President Andrew J. Stein, to withdraw from the mayoral race.

title: Newark Students, Both Good and Bad, Make Do
description: Every morning at Malcolm X Shabazz High School, before Shakespeare or algebra, all 1,215 students form four jagged lines to be patted down for weapons in this South Side neighborhood of vacant lots and ramshackle buildings.

title: F.T.C. Action On Kohlberg
description: The Federal Trade Commission said today that it had relaxed an order that had impeded Kohlberg, Kravis, Roberts & Company's entry into three food-product markets.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: Music Today Merkin Concert Hall

title: Dying Nebraska Town Finds New Hope in Outcast Doctor
description: In the America of shopping malls, cul-de-sacs and home-delivered pizza, Dr. Bernardo G. Bilang would hardly be the first choice of a family looking for a doctor. As a result of questionable medical procedures, he has been forced to surrender his right to practice in one state and has agreed never again to deliver babies in another.

title: Genuine Risk Nearing Labor
description: Three Chimneys Farm near Midway, Ky., reported yesterday that Genuine Risk was "comfortable, healthy and happy" but not yet a mother.

title: Fujitsu Is Considering Resale of I.B.M. Clones
description: In another sign of the upheavals in Japan's once-sheltered personal computer market, Fujitsu Ltd. said today that it is considering buying I.B.M.-compatible machines from a Taiwan company to sell under its own name in Japan.

title: MDC Holdings Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included an extraordinary loss of $ 2,444,000 on early extinguishment of debt, and a gain of $ 1.7 million, or 8 cents a share, reflecting the cumulative effect of a change in the method of accounting for income taxes according to SFAS 109.MDC Holdings said that results of operations in the first quarter of 1993 were hurt by a $ 2 million valuation adjustment in regard to certain of its mortgage-related assets and an additional $ 900,000 of expenses associated with the development of a subdivision in northern California.

title: Rapist Who Agreed to Use Condom Gets 40 Years
description: A jury recommended today that Joel Rene Valdez be sentenced to 40 years in prison for rape in a case that centered on his victim's insistence that he use condoms to protect her from disease and pregnancy.

title: Wembley on Saturday For Wednesday's Harkes
description: JOHN HARKES is the only American ever to appear on English soccer's biggest stage. Today, he returns to Wembley Stadium in London to play in one of the sport's biggest games -- the F.A. Cup final.

title: General Automation reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included extraordinary gains of $ 225,000, or 2 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 450,000, or 4 cents a share, in the 6 months.c-Included extraordinary gains of $ 38,000, or 1 cent a share, in the quarter and $ 76,000, or 1 cent a share, in the 6 months.

title: Bidding for Bonds Is Cleaner
description: Dubious dealings in two bond issues have suddenly intruded on the gubernatorial election race in New Jersey and the mayoral race in New York City. Both cases demonstrate the unsavory influence political money can have in the business of underwriting state and city bonds.

title: Poor Economic News Trims the Dow Further
description: Facing another round of disquieting economic news, the stock market struggled yesterday to erase Thursday's sharp losses.

title: Bridge
description: A famous story by Robert Darvas concerns a professor of logic who taught himself bridge from a book. The club secretary reluctantly permitted him to join a game, but aborted it when the professor's first move, as defender, was to lead from a king into an A-Q combination in dummy on his right. The secretary was then embarrassed when the professor demonstrated that he had found the only winning defense.

title: Observer; Joining Up For Glory
description: Here is another country-club problem. They are always the same. Someone political is found to be a member of or to have played golf at a racially segregated country club. After the discovery, the fat is in the fire, as we used to say back when we still had cliches fit for children's ears.

title: A Bid to Free Olympia Unit From Canada
description: Citibank, the biggest creditor of the American unit of Olympia & York Developments Ltd., the Canadian developer, asked a Federal bankruptcy judge yesterday to bar Canadian influence over the management of the American operation.

title: Campaign Spending: Despised but Addictive
description: In 1976, at the age of 29, I ran for an open seat in Congress and was elected. In a crowded five-way Democratic primary, and in a tough general election campaign, I spent a total of $67,000 to win the seat.

title: Attic Fire Kills Grandmother And 3 of Her Grandchildren
description: For as long as neighbors can remember, the big beige house where Louise Murphy lived had always brimmed with children.

title: DEERE TO SELL FOUNDRY TO AMERICAN BAILEY
description: Deere & Company of Moline, Ill., said yesterday that it would sell its John Deere Foundry unit to the American Bailey Corporation. The price was not disclosed for the foundry, which is in Silvis, Ill. American Bailey's president, Douglas G. Bailey, said he was buying the unit to cast medium-sized diesel engine blocks and heads. American Bailey entered the foundry industry in 1990 by acquiring the CWC Castings division of Textron Inc. American Bailey is privately held. Deere & Company said in September 1991 that it would gradually phase out the Silvis unit.

title: Circling Back to Square One: Fixing the Economy
description: If there was any doubt left about President Clinton's determination to refocus attention on the economy, he dispelled it at his news conference today by twice dismissing questions about homosexuals in the military with terse one-liners that could not possibly make the evening news.

title: Review/Dance; An 'Orpheus' of Balanchine and Stravinsky
description: The New York City Ballet's "Balanchine Celebration" continues on its chronological way. The 1948 Balanchine-Stravinsky "Orpheus," a masterpiece of lyric theater last performed five years ago, returned on Wednesday night to the New York State Theater with Nilas Martins making a debut in the title role.

title: Hamilton Wants In
description: It turns out that SCOTT HAMILTON was on the list of pro skaters who requested reinstatement and a possible chance to qualify for the 1994 Winter Olympics in Lillehammer, Norway. Hamilton applied to the United States Figure Skating Association before the April 1 deadline, but he asked that his application not be made public. He indicated in a statement yesterday that he was not "making a big push for the Olympics."

title: Classical Music in Review
description: Masters of Persian Music Symphony Space

title: Neighbor's 121-Pound Dog Kills a 2-Year-Old Boy in Hicksville
description: A 2-year-old child playing on a swing in a neighbor's backyard in Hicksville, L.I., was killed by the neighbor's dog yesterday, the police said.

title: CLINTON EXPECTED TO ORDER RENEWAL OF NUCLEAR TESTS
description: With a Congressional moratorium on nuclear testing due to expire on July 1, President Clinton is expected to approve a plan that would allow underground blasts to resume by the end of the year, Administration officials said today.

title: Cellular Communications (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After a gain of $ 8 million, or 18 cents a share, from the adoption of new method of accounting for income taxes.c-Net loss

title: 2 Universities Lose Technology Grant Status
description: Criticizing their handling of grants to advance high-technology research, Columbia University and the Polytechnic University of New York yesterday lost their designations as state centers for advanced technology.

title: Polishing a New York Diamond in the Rough
description: Manny Ramirez sat here in the visitors' dugout on a recent drizzly afternoon, fidgeting with a bat and uncomfortably fielding questions about his fledgling professional baseball career.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: The King's Singers Alice Tully Hall

title: Sports of The Times; Islanders Climbing Jacob's Ladder
description: LARRY MURPHY wasn't the first Penguin to come out of the locker room, but he was the first to speak.

title: Knicks Play 2 Overtimes and Come Away Just 1 Up
description: This time it was the Charlotte Hornets who made the biggest plays in the waning moments. This time it was the Hornets who won a tense, emotional, playoff game that could have gone either way. This time it was the Knicks who suffered a bitter defeat.

title: Horror's Stigma Still Clings to a Disbarred Lawyer
description: One winter morning 15 years ago, a 48-year-old lawyer named Robert T. Rowe simply snapped. As his eldest son lay sleeping, Mr. Rowe killed him with a baseball bat. Then he killed his daughter, and then his second son, in the same grisly way. When his wife returned from work, he bludgeoned her to death as well.

title: Land Mines in Stocks A Reason to Diversify
description: IF I just knew where I was going to die, the old saying goes, I would be sure never to go there. Investors in I.B.M., Merck, Wal-Mart, Philip Morris and a host of other former favorites might wish for the same sort of foresight. Some strategists say that avoiding death-trap stocks during the rest of the decade will be more crucial than picking the next Microsoft.

title: METRO DIGEST
description: NEW YORK CITY STEIN IS ASKED TO QUIT RACE

title: In Clinton Plan, More People May Fall Under the Alternative Minimum Tax
description: The well-to-do are well aware that their income taxes are likely to go up under the Clinton Administration's tax proposal, which was adopted with relatively few changes on Thursday by the House Ways and Means Committee.

title: Howell Industries reports earnings for Qtr to April 30
Envirotest Systems Corp.  (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: Envirotest Systems noted that results for the second quarter of 1993 do not reflect its initial public offering of $ 125 million of debt and 3.4 million shares of equity securities and related transactions, all of which were completed in April 1993 and will be reflected in the third quarter ending June 30.Envirotest added, however, that the results for the latest quarter and 6 months do reflect its acquisition of Envirotest Technologies Inc. in April 1992, which accounts for much of the increase in revenues and earnings.Additionally, Envirotest said its British Columbia program began operations on Sept, 1, 1992, and contributed $ 2.6 million in contract revenues during the latest quarter.

title: Beliefs; From an uprising a quarter-century ago, a lesson of persistence in the utopian faith.
description: Paris 25 years ago, May 10, 1968.

title: Trade Pact Group Forms; Its Legality Is Questioned
description: Mickey Kantor, the United States trade representative, has organized a coalition of state and local officials to support the North American Free Trade Agreement, prompting a Democratic Congressman to call for an investigation of whether the group violates Federal law.

title: Revocation of Bail Sought In Glen Ridge Abuse Case
description: Prosecutors today denounced the three former high school football players convicted in the Glen Ridge sex-assault case as threats to society and urged a New Jersey appeals court to order them jailed immediately.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: Bryant Park Young Performers Series Bryant Park

title: SHARES OF INFORMIX CLIMB TO 52-WEEK HIGH
description: Shares of the Informix Corporation jumped to a 52-week high after the company, a maker of data base software, said it would repurchase up to one million shares and complete a 2-for-1 stock split. Informix's shares were up $4.125, to $43.25, in Nasdaq trading. The company, based in Menlo Park, Calif., said shareholders of record on May 28 would receive two shares for every Informix common share, increasing shares outstanding to 64 million from 31.8 million. In addition, Informix plans to buy back a million common shares in cash as part of the company's stock option and purchase plan and employee stock program. Informix shares have more than tripled since last July, when the stock was trading at slightly above $12. (Bloomberg Business News)

title: Plenty of New Offerings, But Read the Fine Print
description: CAN you be tempted with a rebate on your next G.M. or Ford automobile? Or some cash tossed into a retirement savings plan for every purchase you make?

title: Monica Healea, 93, Physicist and Artist
description: Dr. Monica Healea, physics professor emeritus and former chairman of the physics department at Vassar College, died on Tuesday at a nursing home in Rhinebeck, N.Y. She was 93.

title: Adaptec Inc. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
A Recording Label Born in a Taxi
description: Driving a taxi in New York City does for most people's mental health what a market crash does for investors' psyches. But one Wall Street exile turned his dilapidated cab into a combination psychologist's couch and power office.

title: Oshawa Group reports earnings for Qtr to April 17
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.The company is listed on the Toronto and Montreal stock exchanges.

title: Airgas Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
It's 718 Tomorrow
description: The Bronx joins the 718 area code this Sunday after a transition period that began July 1, 1992. During the transition period, callers could dial either the 718 or 212 area code and still reach the Bronx, but beginning at 12:01 A.M. Sunday they must use the 718 area code only.

title: CHRONICLE
description: The name of the game at the Waldorf-Astoria on Thursday evening was autograph collecting, a sport that blase New York partygoers normally scorn.

title: Few Hits on Human Rights
description: Candidate Bill Clinton talked tough about human rights, promising a harder line on abuses in China, Haiti and Bosnia. As President, he's fielded an excellent team to devise and carry out policy. Yet the results so far are mixed: tough on some issues, tentative on others -- mainly China.

title: DVI Health Services reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Saving at the Office: New Choices Near
description: William R. Mitchell, an administrator at the Public Service Electric and Gas Company in Newark, has been a participant in his corporation's 401(k) savings plan since it began about 12 years ago.

title: Review/Dance; Some Mythical Women at Their Own Round Table
description: Twenty-one years have passed since the premiere of Meredith Monk's "Education of the Girlchild." But some things never change. The crowd outside the Joyce Theater on Tuesday night waited patiently for the doors to open just as Ms. Monk's first audiences once waited on rainy sidewalks outside performance lofts downtown. Inside the theater, a woman once more sat quietly alone onstage, already in her own world as the audience filed in.

title: Santiago Journal; Is He 'Merchant of Death' or Scapegoat for U.S.?
description: He has been called the "merchant of death" and a "black widow spider" by United States officials, but he is known around town by diplomats and officials as Carlos, the man who amassed hundreds of millions of dollars by making lethal weapons and exporting them to Iraq.

title: Corrections
description: An article yesterday about provisions of tax legislation approved by the House Ways and Means Committee misstated the tax treatment of certain tax-free bonds purchased for less than their face value. The increase in value of such bonds as they approach maturity is usually free of taxes. But under current law in some cases -- including those in which bonds were purchased for less than the original offering price -- part of the gain from the sale is taxed as a capital gain. Under the proposed legislation, that part would be taxed as ordinary income.

title: Even Nice Pets Can Harm Wildfowl
description: To the Editor:

title: Oliver Tambo Memorial
description: A memorial service for Oliver R. Tambo, who helped to lead the fight against apartheid in South Africa, will be held at 2 P.M. tomorrow at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine, on Amsterdam Avenue at 112th Street in Manhattan. Mr. Tambo, who was president of the African National Congress for 25 years, died three weeks ago. Scheduled speakers include Mayor David N. Dinkins, Harry Belafonte, Theodore Sorensen and H. Carl McCall, the New York State Comptroller.

title: Europe's New Airline Rules Displease U.S.
description: The European Community has adopted measures limiting air fare cuts and access by United States carriers, in a move that could fuel a trans-Atlantic trade war, Government officials say.

title: Review/Theater; A Couple's Life, in One Act
description: Through his numerous one-act comedies, David Ives has proved that he is a master of verbal gymnastics, manipulating language to comment on the difficulties of communication. While retaining his linguistic dexterity, Mr. Ives has shifted dramatic ground in his new one-act, "Long Ago and Far Away."

title: Gasoline Prices Rise
description: Average statewide self-serve gasoline prices increased more than a penny a gallon in the last two weeks, the New York State Energy Commissioner's Office reported today. An energy office retail price survey for April 30-May 13 disclosed that regular unleaded rose 1.50 cents a gallon, to $1.19; middle-grade unleaded rose 1.10 cents, to $1.30, and premium unleaded rose 1.60 cents, to $1.38. The increases were the third-largest biweekly increase since June 1992.

title: Federal Realty Investment Trust Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
NEWS SUMMARY
description: International 2-5 U.S. HAS NUCLEAR TESTING PLAN

title: Cheating in College Athletics
description: It's scarcely news that college athletics is corrupt. What's stunning is that Dick Schultz, the reform-minded executive director of the National Collegiate Athletic Association, has resigned because of a scandal specific to him.

title: Corrections
description: An article on April 28 about President Clinton's appointment of 47 doctors, nurses and other medical experts to assess his health plan included an erroneous specialty identification issued by the White House for one physician, Dr. Stanley Yarnell. He is a physiatrist, a specialist in physical medicine and rehabilitation, not a psychiatrist.

title: Hakeem for the Defense
description: HAKEEM OLAJUWON, the league leader in blocked shots for the third time in the last four seasons and the leader among centers in steals, yesterday won the National Basketball Association defensive player of the year award.

title: Whites Long Welcome At Black Colleges
description: To the Editor:

title: My Hopes, My Fears, My Disease
description: For four years, I have been torn about when and how to say publicly that I carry H.I.V., the virus that causes AIDS. There were always too many compelling reasons not to say anything. Every such excuse started with the word "fear" -- fear of employment discrimination, fear of the politics of AIDS, fear of becoming a pariah.

title: Barrett Resources Corp.  (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included a gain of $ 583,000, or 6 cents a share, reflecting change in accounting for income taxes.

title: German Union Reaches Accord to End Strike
description: A strike by thousands of eastern German metalworkers appeared close to an end today after labor and management negotiators reached a compromise agreement in Saxony state giving the workers substantial wage increases but extending the timetable for achieving parity with western German pay levels.

title: Alcohol's Benefits
description: To the Editor:

title: AMERICAN STUDIOS' STOCK LOSES 20% OF ITS VALUE
description: Shares of American Studios Inc. continued to slide yesterday, losing 20 percent of their value, after dropping 39 percent on Thursday, amid concerns about slowing growth. The Charlotte, N.C., provider of portrait photography studios in Wal-Mart stores told analysts that current trends in customer counts, revenue and earnings will be below estimates for the second quarter. Shares of American Studios dropped $1.75 yesterday, to $7, in Nasdaq trading. The stock has dropped $7.25, or 51 percent, since Wednesday. The stock slide is a blow to Merrill Lynch & Company, the financial services giant. Merrill Lynch Interfunding, a venture capital affiliate of the New York-based brokerage, owns about six million shares, or 29 percent, of American Studios stock.

title: Lowe's Cos.  reports earnings for Qtr to April 30
description: Share data were adjusted for 2-for-1 stock split in the form of a dividend, effective June 29, 1992.

title: The Baron Of the Bronx -- Second of two articles.; In an Antipoverty Empire, A Clinic Is an Opportunity
description: Despite its fresh coat of paint, the large forest-green medical clinic at Westchester and Metcalf Avenues in the Soundview section of the Bronx echoes the blandness of its surroundings -- a row of private homes, some elevated train tracks, an empty supermarket.

title: Connecticut Water Service Inc. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
HARRAH'S SEEKS 20% OF CASINO IN COLORADO
description: Harrah's, the casino unit of the Promus Companies, said yesterday that it planned to buy a 20 percent stake in the Glory Hole Casino in Central City, Colo., from Central City Gaming Investors L.P., for undisclosed terms. The agreement would mark Harrah's entry into the Colorado limited-stakes gaming market, subject to state regulatory approval and the issuance of a Colorado gaming license. Harrah's plans to manage the Glory Hole Casino under the Harrah's name. The Glory Hole Casino is one of the largest gaming operations in Colorado, Promus said. It has about 40,000 square feet of space and houses 530 slot or video machines and 12 gaming tables.

title: Independence Holding Co.  (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included a gain of $ 1,199,000, or 7 cents a share, reflecting the cumulative effect of adopting Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.109, ''Accounting for Income Taxes.''

title: Plans to Revise School Board Are Stalled
description: Despite general agreement that New York City's schools need fixing, efforts in the State Legislature to restructure the system are being stalled by regional differences, partisan politics and an ideological dispute over who should have ultimate authority over the nation's largest school system.

title: Vacationing on the Run: Getting Away From It All at the Last Minute
description: Profile: Grace and William Chen and their two daughters Cheryl, 7, and Crystal, 6, of Manhattan, like to vacation in the Caribbean, About six years ago they discovered that they could get inexpensive holidays if they willinf to forfeit long-range planning in exchange for some last minute gambles.

title: Gerrity Oil & Gas (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included a gain of $ 1.1 million, or 8 cents a share, from the adoption of change in accounting principle for FAS 109.

title: A School System -- For the Kids
description: If New Yorkers needed further proof that the city school system requires a drastic overhaul, they now have it in the election of Carol Gresser as president of the Board of Education. Ms. Gresser, from Queens, represents the narrow interests that have dominated the board for the last year. She also cast the deciding vote in the 4-to-3 decision to fire Schools Chancellor Joseph Fernandez.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: CARDIS CORP., Buena Park, Calif., sold its Northern California operations to Auto Parts Wholesalers Inc. and seeks a buyer for the remainder of its operations to pay off creditors. FOURTH FINANCIAL CORP., Wichita, Kan., purchased Guaranty Bancorporation, and merged Guaranty's subsidiary Guaranty Bank and Trust Company of Tulsa, Okla., with its own Bank IV Oklahoma.

title: This Time, Race Goes to the Swiftest
description: The battle raged for 58 minutes, and maybe the single most important moment came when Anthony Mason lost a footrace he didn't know he was in to the smallest man on the floor, Muggsy Bogues.

title: Pentagon Budget Vote Is Delayed Over Gay Issue
description: Fearing an embarrassing setback for President Clinton, House Democrats have postponed a vote on the 1994 military budget to prevent Republicans from attaching an amendment preserving the ban on homosexuals in the military, Congressional officials said today.

title: NBC's New Fall Lineup: The Year of The Divorced
description: Roughly half of all marriages end in divorce, so perhaps it is appropriate that roughly half of NBC's new shows center on divorced people.

title: A Patchwork Lineup Unravels on the Mets
description: The defeats keep coming, in all misshapes and sizes. Any attempt to rank them this season has amounted to a joyless, even masochistic, enterprise. The Mets, though, might have ended the exercise tonight, for it would require a rare, even morbid, imagination to conceive a defeat more grisly than the 8-7 loss to the Expos at Olympic Stadium.

title: Tariff Cuts Advance in New Talks
description: Trade ministers from the United States, the European Community, Japan and Canada breathed new life into moribund global trade talks today.

title: Employee Benefit Plans Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Review/Music; 'Freischutz' in Concert: A Case for the Defense
description: Sir Colin Davis led the New York Philharmonic in an exuberant concert performance of "Der Freischutz" on Thursday night in an attempt to make a case for an opera that, in recent decades, has been a complete flop at both the City Opera and the Metropolitan.

title: 30 Congresswomen Want Health Plan To Cover Abortion
description: Thirty women in the House of Representatives called on the Clinton Administration today to include abortion services in the benefits package guaranteed under its health-care plan.

title: GTE PHONE NEAR SALE OF KANSAS ACCESS LINES
description: The GTE Corporation said yesterday that its GTE Telephone unit had signed a definitive agreement to sell its Kansas telephone-service area to the Lynch Corporation. Terms were not disclosed. GTE said in January that it was seeking a buyer for its 2,300 access lines in Kansas. The sale is part of GTE's effort to concentrate the company's telephone exchanges in large clusters by selling or trading small local exchanges. The effort is intened to increase the efficiency of its services, GTE said. Upon completion of the transaction, Lynch, of Greenwich, Conn., will serve 10,750 access lines in Kansas, New Hampshire, New Mexico, North Dakota, and Wisconsin. GTE, based in Stamford, Conn., services 21 million lines in 40 states, Canada and South America.

title: Delta Queen Steamboat (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net lossc-On a pro-forma basis fourth quarter net income would be $ 400 assuming the March 1992 sale of 4.1 million common shares was completed in April 1991. This would have resulted in certain savings. For the year, pro forma net income was $ 4.2 million.

title: DIGITRAN PURCHASES ASSETS OF FREELAND FLAME
description: Digitran Systems Inc., based in Logan, Utah, said yesterday that it had purchased the assets of Freeland Flame Systems Inc. for undisclosed terms. Freeland, based in Spokane, Wash., sells a patented pellet stove for home heating and an electronic self-ignition system that enables a person to operate the stove from a wall thermostat. More than 300 of the stoves have been sold.

title: French Toddlers Freed Unharmed; Gunman Shot
description: Six toddlers and their teacher were freed unharmed this morning after being held by a masked gunman for two days at their nursery school in this leafy suburb of Paris.

title: U.S. Industry's Sluggish Pace
description: People have been worrying for years that America's industrial base, if not shrinking outright, has at the very least been expanding quite slowly.

title: Don't Take That A Train! Ever! I Mean It, Son!
description: THERE are moments known to most parents when a child deserves a kick in the pants and a pat on the back at the same time. The kid has done something foolish, even dangerous, but it is also cute, funny, clever. You shout, you tremble, but you could break into laughter at any second. In years to come what you will recall is not how the 6-year-old almost blew up the house but how serious she looked turning on the gas to bake Play-Doh cookies.

title: Pavarotti Concert in the Park
description: Luciano Pavarotti, now fully recovered from his recent knee surgery, and looking only slightly trimmer than before he underwent a weight-loss program this winter, announced yesterday that he would sing a free concert at the Great Lawn in Central Park on June 26, accompanied by members of the New York Philharmonic.

title: Long Drive Keeps Davies Ahead of Pack
description: Before there was a John Daly, there was Laura Davies.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: Nationwide Cellular Service Inc. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Berkshire Hathaway Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included realized investment gain of $ 16,630,000, or $ 14.43 a share, and after a charge of $ 70,984,000 from the cumulative effect of change in accounting for income taxes.c-Included realized investment gain of $ 747,000, or 65 cents a share.

title: Nigeria Moves Toward Civilian Rule
description: To the Editor:

title: Corrections
description: Picture captions with the Chronicle column yesterday were reversed in some copies. The man shown was Dan Rather; the woman was Evelyn Lauder.

title: HEWLETT-PACKARD TO BUY BT& D TECHNOLOGIES
description: The Hewlett-Packard Company plans to buy BT& D Technologies Ltd. in a bid to give one-stop shopping to customers setting up a fiber optics network. Adding the high-speed fiber optics components made by BT& D will give Hewlett-Packard the "broadest range of fiber optics components" in the world.

title: Boeing and Air Force Discuss Air Transport Jets
description: The Boeing Company said today that it was discussing with the Air Force offering military versions of its 767 and 747 jetliners for air transport use.

title: Results Plus
description: TENNIS Sampras and Courier Advance in Rome Pete Sampras, No. 1 in the world, and Jim Courier, the man ranked behind him, advanced to the semifinals by overpowering two clay-court specialists yesterday at the Italian Open in Rome. Sampras routed unseeded Guillermo Perez-Roldan, 6-0, 6-2, in just over an hour in a match interrupted twice by rain. Courier, the defending champion and playing in his first clay-court tournament of the year, never lost his serve in defeating seventh-seeded Sergi Bruguera, 6-3, 6-4. Sixth-seeded Michael Chang saved two match points and went on to defeat Andrei Chesnokov, 6-3, 5-7, 7-5, in 3 hours 38 minutes, the year's longest three-set match on the tour. Big-serving Goran Ivanisevic of Croatia, seeded fourth, downed Marcelo Filippini, 7-6 (7-4), 6-4, to also reach the semifinals. In today's semifinals, Sampras will play Ivanisevic, and Courier will face Chang. It's the first time in the tournament's 50-year history that three Americans have reached the semifinals.

title: Earning Some Extra Frequent Flier Miles Without Actually Getting on a Plane
description: You've managed to accumulate, say, 18,000 miles on Continental Airlines' frequent flier program. That puts you only 2,000 miles short of the 20,000 miles needed to qualify for a round-trip coach fare anywhere in the continental United States -- an agonizingly close call.

title: Four Admit Guilt In Fraud Schemes
description: In a blow to the owners of an armored-car company who are accused of stealing $38 million, four people pleaded guilty today to charges stemming from the scheme.

title: Improbable. Impossible. Incredible. Islanders.
description: They are still a long shot and still an underdog. But as one of the teams now in hockey's Final Four, the Islanders (the Islanders?) have a realistic, legitimate chance to win the Stanley Cup.

title: Michael J. Merkin, Paint Innovator, 99, And Philanthropist
description: Michael J. Merkin, a leader in the paint industry, a banker and a philanthropist, died on Thursday at his home in Manhattan. He was 99.

title: Review/Rock; The Kinks, Old Hands, Remain on the Wild Side
description: Rock 'n' roll (as opposed to the more corporate Rock-and-Roll) has always deified the amateur, making inspiration the product of divine intervention more than hard work. The Kinks, some 30 years after coming together as a group, performed at the Academy on Thursday night. Here's what their lead singer and songwriter, Ray Davies, had to say after claiming that the induction of the band into the Rock-and-Roll Hall of Fame in 1990 had not affected it: "We're more untogether than ever. Let's hear it for imperfection!"

title: Q & A
description: Finding Net Worth Q. How can I calculate my net worth?

title: Agency Takes Step Toward Banning Whaling in Southern Ocean
description: The International Whaling Commission today took the first step toward declaring one quarter of the world's oceans off limits to whaling, even if the current ban on whaling ends.

title: World Income Group: Hot but Mind the Risk
description: The chief appeal of the 45 short-term world income funds, which invest mainly in government securities around the world, is their yield: 6.8 percent in March, 4 percentage points more than money market funds.

title: Bede Griffiths, 86, Catholic Monk Who Sought Ties to East, Is Dead
description: The Rev. Bede Griffiths, a Roman Catholic monk and author who strove to bridge Christianity and the Hindu and Buddhist traditions of India, died on Thursday in the ashram he had headed since 1968 in southeastern India. He was 86.

title: Miltope Group Inc. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
High Bacteria Levels Found in Bay Ridge Water
description: Residents of Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, should boil their tap water before drinking or cooking with it because routine testing has found bacteria that can cause nausea, cramps, diarrhea and other symptoms, city officials said yesterday.

title: Excerpts From Clinton's News Conference in the Rose Garden
description: Following are excerpts from President Clinton's news conference yesterday in the Rose Garden at the White House, as transcribed by Reuters. OPENING STATEMENT

title: A Campus Case: Speech or Harassment?
description: Amid preparations for Monday's commencement exercises, University of Pennsylvania officials spent much of today dealing with the racial tension that has plagued the campus over the last semester.

title: Amoco Canada Petroleum reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: The results are in Canadian dollars.On a U.S. basis, net income was $ 53 million. The difference between the two is the treatment of foreign currency gains and losses, and income taxes. There was no income in the year-earlier quarter on a U.S. basis.Amoco Canada is a unit of Amoco Corp.

title: Black Enterprise Names Cross Colours as No. 1
description: Three years ago, the apparel designer Carl Jones took a $200,000 bankroll from cashing out of a successful surf sportswear maker and financed Cross Colours, which makes a line of hip-hop clothing that mainstream merchants are clamoring for.

title: TRANSACTIONS
description: Baseball American League MILWAUKEE BREWERS -- Activated Robin Yount, outfielder, from the 15-day disabled list. Optioned Troy O'Leary, outfielder, to New Orleans in the American Association.

title: Loblolly Preakness Harbinger
description: For omens, consider Aztec Hill. She is the stablemate to Prairie Bayou, the favorite for the Preakness Stakes, and she set an upbeat tone for Loblolly Stable today when she outran nine rivals and won the 69th Black-Eyed Susan Stakes, one of racing's classics for 3-year-old fillies.

title: NORTHGATE IS SELLING CAMPBELL RESOURCES STAKE
description: Northgate Exploration Ltd. said yesterday that it had agreed to sell its 34.5 percent interest in Campbell Resources Inc. for $29.3 million. The transaction must be approved by regulators. Northgate will issue a special warrant to divest itself of its stake. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed. The transaction is expected to close on June 3. Both companies mine gold in North America.

title: BELGRADE MEETING BACKS PEACE PLAN
description: At a tumultuous meeting marked by insults, accusations and angry walkouts, three Serbian legislatures endorsed an international peace plan for Bosnia and Herzegovina today and urged the Bosnian Serbs to sign it.

title: OMI Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included a pretax gain of $ 1,994,000 on seven supply workboats.

title: Volek Redeems a Miserable Season
description: Pierre Turgeon returned heroically for the Islanders tonight, only 16 days after his separated shoulder was supposed to keep him out for the remainder of the playoffs. But the biggest hero for the Islanders was David Volek, a player who, recently, has often had to sit and watch.

title: A U.N. Agency May Leave China Over Coercive Population Control
description: Alarmed by indications of a harsh family planning crackdown in the Chinese countryside, the United Nations Population Fund is considering withdrawing from China and ending its work in the most populous country in the world.

title: Survey Shows Confidence Off
description: Consumer confidence waned in May for the fourth consecutive month, according to a survey by the University of Michigan.

title: Ex-Soviet Nations Agree to Form Economic Union
description: Nine of the 15 former Soviet republics, including Russia, today signed a declaration of intent to form an economic union to try to restore cohesion to their ruptured relationships.

title: To Fake It Well on the Set, It Pays to Be Genuine
description: Transforming John Guare's Broadway play "Six Degrees of Separation" into a movie can present challenges both visual and dramatic. In Fred Schepisi's film ver sion of Mr. Guare's 1990 work, the visual arts perform two critical, almost starring roles. A double-sided Kandinsky holds the place of honor in a New York apartment where much of the action takes place. And Michelangelo's ceiling in the Sistine Chapel, described but never seen in the play, had to be created for the movie, which is now being filmed in New York.

title: Five Houses on a Tour of Park Hill
description: WHEN Norman and Debbey Weinstein moved to the Park Hill section of Yonkers 11 years ago, he was an English professor and she a social worker. Now they are established collectors and dealers of furniture and accessories from the Arts and Crafts period -- and it all started with their 1911 Arts and Crafts-style Park Hill house.

title: Quantity of Lawyers; Quality of Justice
description: The dean of the Yale Law School, Professor Guido Calabresi, demonstrated a disappointing lack of concern for the harmful effects of excessive litigation on our society when he states ". . . too many lawyers means an awful lot of people have legal rights protected . . ." [ "An Advocate of the Law (and of Lawyers)," April 25 ] . We would do well to question whether the quality of our judicial system is directly proportional to the number of attorneys available and the quantity of litigation that they produce.

title: Lisa A. Settle, N. T. Callaway Jr.
description: September wedding plans have been announced for Lisa Anne Settle and Norman Tooker Callaway Jr., the son of Mr. Callaway Sr. of Princeton, N.J., and Elisabeth Ann Callaway of Cranbury, N.J., by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. William S. Settle of Palm Beach, Fla.

title:
Profile/William H. Gross;
Playing for Keeps With a $45 Billion Stake
description: In the early 1970's, when the focus for traders was on stocks, William H. Gross, whose qualifications included a master's degree in finance and success at the Las Vegas blackjack tables, felt the lure. But in a bear market, the only job he could land was clipping bond coupons for the Pacific Mutual Life Insurance Company in Los Angeles.

title: Corrections
description: An article last Sunday about the Reality female condom misstated the annual pregnancy rate among users. It is 21 to 26 percent, not 2.8 percent. This high rate is believed by the Food and Drug Administration and the company to have resulted from improper use. The study found that women who use Reality correctly every time have a pregnancy rate of about 10 percent.

title: Sampras Is Toppled By Ivanisevic in Rome
description: Goran Ivanisevic of Croatia came to Rome hoping to win a couple of matches. Instead, he may leave with his first Italian Open title.

title: Sound Bytes; Compaq's Completely Portable Executive
description: Lorie Strong is vice president, portable software marketing, for the Compaq Computer Corporation. She is responsible for all of Compaq's portable computers, from concept to retirement, as well as planning all aspects of the operating system, diagnostic, networking and software for Compaq's desktop computer systems. She has directed the introductions of many Compaq products, including the flagship Deskpro series. She also has corporate responsibility for primary market research. Before joining Compaq in 1984, she was a product planner for A.T.& T.

title: What Grows Around Comes Around
description: THE TREE IN THE WOOD Adapted and illustrated by Christopher Manson. Unpaged. New York: North/South Books. $14.95. (Ages 5 to 8)

title: Ms. Hilton, Dr. Zimmermann
description: Alicia Marie Hilton, a special agent in New York for the Federal Bureau of Investigation, was married yesterday to Dr. William Robert Zimmermann, a resident in anesthesiology at New York Hospital-Cornell Medical Center. The Rev. Ronald D. Meyer performed the Episcopal ceremony at Christ Church and Holy Family in Brooklyn.

title: Potent Disagreement
description: To the Editor:

title: Sarah Radcliffe, Drew Quigley
description: Dr. and Mrs. Warren A. Radcliffe of Mountainville, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter Sarah Townsend Radcliffe to Andrew Lawrence Quigley 2d, a son of Mrs. Cornelius J. Reid Jr. of Mill Neck, L.I., and the late Lawrence A. Quigley. An October wedding is planned.

title: Possible Backfire?
description: To the Editor:

title: Diane Iacobucci and Gregg Deger
description: Diane Elizabeth Iacobucci, a daughter of Olga Iacobucci of Rockville Centre, L.I., and Rudolph Iacobucci of Hampton Bays, L.I., was married yesterday to Gregg Jeffrey Deger, a son of Trudy Deger of Huntington Station, L.I., and George Deger of Boynton Beach, Fla. Msgr. Edmond J. Trench performed the ceremony at the Sacred Hearts of Jesus and Mary Roman Catholic Church in Southampton, L.I.

title: She Outplayed Them, Then Outlasted Them
description: In a sport that gradually but inexorably grinds to the psychic nub those who play it for a living, no champion has proven more resistant to erosion than JoAnne Carner.

title: Bergman Does Ibsen
description: Opening-night dinner for a Swedish production at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, May 11.

title: So Small in the Presence of Death
description: I'LL SEE YOU IN MY DREAMS By Mavis Jukes. Illustrated by Stacey Schuett. Unpaged. New York: Alfred A. Knopf. $15. (Ages 7 to 11)

title: A Synthesis of East and West
description: WHETHER they are read as direct impressions or as automatist evocations, Kang-So Lee's paintings refer to landscape that is more water than land. Each includes the outline of a duck or a boat (mostly it is the duck, or ducks), which the artist includes as if inscribing his signature.

title: FEWER JOBS FILLED AS FACTORIES RELY ON OVERTIME PAY
description: In another sign of how hard it is to create jobs, American manufacturers are paying record amounts of overtime and factory workers are putting in more extra hours than ever before. By relying on so much overtime, companies have avoided hiring and jobs in manufacturing have continued to disappear.

title: Patricia McKeogh, W. E. Bandon 3d
description: Mrs. Robert P. McKeogh of Williamsburg, Va., has announced the engagement of her daughter Patricia Linden McKeogh to William Edward Bandon 3d, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Bandon of Somers, N.Y. A September wedding is planned.

title: Disney World
description: To the Editor: While enjoying Lynn Freed's article on a visit to Disney World ("It's A Small Unnatural World," April 11), I was reminded of our 5-year-old daughter's comment on our visit to Disney World in the 70's. On leaving the 10,000 Leagues Under the Sea ride she asked, "Is the water plastic, too, Mommy?"

title: Technology; Putting the Tag on Shoplifters
description: IT was one of the retailing industry's most precise field experiments yet involving merchandising, consumer behavior and the criminal mind.

title: CONNECTICUT GUIDE
description: PERRY IN TOKYO

title: Lebow to Be Honored
description: FRED LEBOW, the director and founder of the New York City Marathon, CHARLES H. McCABE JR., the executive vice president of Chemical Banking Corp., JACK RUDIN, the president of his own real estate firm, and Manhattan Borough President PERCY SUTTON will be honored by Iona College at the school's trustee award dinner-dance at the Waldorf-Astoria on May 19.

title: Anatomy of Islander Upset: 'No Passengers on Bus'
description: When David Volek scored at 5 minutes 16 seconds of overtime Friday night to give the Islanders a 4-3 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins, he concluded a remarkable upset for a team that had been lightly regarded and only marginally successful during the National Hockey League's regular season.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International 3-13 SERBS DEFIANT AS THEY VOTE

title: MAY 9-15: Colombian Plot Charged; Three Indicted in the Murder Of a Crusading Journalist
description: After 14 months of doggedly pursuing the killers of the crusading Spanish-language journalist Manuel de Dios Unanue, Federal law enforcement officials last week indicted three young men who they said had been acting on the orders of drug lords in Colombia.

title: Calling the Rich the Rich
description: To the Editor:

title:
In the Region: Long Island;
Preserving Historic Buildings in the Parks
description: THE impact of public spending cuts is being felt heavily by the conservators of Long Island's historic properties.

title: So Easy to Fail at Love
description: REBEL POWERSBy Richard Bausch.390 pp. Boston: Seymour Lawrence/Houghton Mifflin. $21.95.

title: Riding High (or Upside Down)
description: A new generation of roller coasters -- Batman the Ride, Top Gun and Days of Thunder -- reflects Hollywood's grip on the popular imagination.

title: Patrick O'Brian's Ship Comes In
description: Starling Lawrence, an editor at W. W. Norton in New York, first heard about the Irish novelist Patrick O'Brian in 1986. Lawrence was having a friendly drink with a literary-minded cousin when he unexpectedly found himself the target of a belligerent tirade. "How can you call yourself a publisher?" his cousin demanded. "Here is this genius Patrick O'Brian and you're not publishing him. Nobody in the United States is."

title: Of Truth, Beauty and the Moment When a Photo Becomes Art
description: To the Editor:

title: Schools As Magnets For Balance
description: EVER since Gov. Lowell P. Weicker Jr. challenged Connecticut school districts earlier this year to address racial isolation or face the possibility of court-ordered desegregation plans, school districts have scrambled to take control of their futures. Proposals for new magnet schools, which are designed to attract out-of-district students with a specialized curriculum, are in the works. At the same time educators are seizing the opportunity for change to combine integration plans with educational reform and innovation.

title: Ov Rivers Remote and Vast
description: THEY ARE AT WAR," says Jose. He inhales, filling his lungs with the deep, fecund musk of the river. "There are war parties up the Casiquiare where we're going tomorrow, so there'll be no photographs."

title: Connecticut Q&A: Anne L. Pierce; A Space Career Booster, Against the Odds
description: THREE decades after President John F. Kennedy set in motion a space program that finally put a man on the moon, President Clinton, who likens himself to Kennedy in many other respects, is deliberating about whether the nation needs expensive programs like the space station.

title: The 'Forgotten Borough' Makes Its Voice Heard
description: Queens, the self-described "forgotten borough" that nearly broke John V. Lindsay, cemented Edward I. Koch's neoconservative coalition, and gave Rudolph W. Giuliani more votes than David N. Dinkins received from any single borough four years ago, is flexing its political muscles again.

title: MAY 9-15: A Larcenous Cash Machine; Thanks for the P.I.N., And Have a Nice Day
description: It was a high-tech bank robbery worthy of Mission Impossible. Three smooth-talking men, claiming to be from a bank in New Jersey, installed an automated teller machine in a Manchester, Conn., shopping mall late last month. When shoppers tried to withdraw money, it returned the cards, citing technical problems while secretly recording the card number and the card holders' personal identification number.

title: THE GUIDE
description: JAY OPEN HOUSE

title: 'Forever in the Shadow of Hitler?'
description: To the Editor:

title: Where the Streets Are Paved With Depositors
description: S&L HELL The People and the Politics Behind the $1 Trillion Savings and Loan Scandal. By Kathleen Day. 416 pp. New York: W. W. Norton & Company.

title: Few Residents of Bensonhurst Attend a Meeting to Reduce Racial Tensions
description: A committee formed to study racial and ethnic tensions in New York City neighborhoods held its first community meeting yesterday at a Bensonhurst high school, but few local residents turned out despite advance publicity about the event.

title:
NORTHEAST NOTEBOOK: Boothbay Harbor, Me.;
Getting Maine With Florida
description: HOME development has resumed at a site in Maine that is aimed, in part, at attracting owners who would like to divide their time between Maine and Florida. The land, a 59-acre site bought for $95,000 at a bank foreclosure auction five years ago, is covered in birches and pine; it starts about a half mile from the harbor of this picturesque coastal town and meanders along a mile-and-a-half strip perpendicular to the water.

title: 'Nothing to Do With Art'
description: To the Editor:

title: Jamie Larowitz and Steven Sherman
description: Jamie Mara Larowitz, a daughter of Shirley and Paul Larowitz of Brooklyn, was married last evening to Steven Jason Sherman, the son of Ruth Sherman of Swampscott, Mass., and the late Barney Sherman. Judge I. Leo Glasser of Federal District Court in Brooklyn performed the ceremony at the Manhattan Penthouse.

title: BENEFITS
description: A Ballet Theater Gala MONDAY -- The American Ballet Theater will benefit from a 7:30 P.M. performance at the Metropolitan Opera House that will feature a tribute to the late Sir Kenneth MacMillan, the British choreographer. A dinner-dance will follow at the Promenade of the New York State Theater, where Peter Duchin and his orchestra will perform. Black tie. Tickets, $650, or $225 for those under 35, from (212) 477-3030, ext. 246.

title: Robyn E. Rituno, Robert S. Gorin
description: Robyn Ellen Rituno, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Rituno of Rye, N.Y., was married last evening to Robert Scott Gorin, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Gorin of Framingham, Mass. Rabbi Robert Rothman performed the ceremony at Tappan Hill in Tarrytown, N.Y.

title: . . .And the Shadowy Figure Who Dreamed It Up
description: Vast expanses of scrambled eggs, laden with salt. A strip steak, medium rare, glistening with globules of fat. Rye toast, buttered. Home fries. Ketchup. Steak sauce. Coffee. Orange juice. A large paper cup filled to the brim with Coca-Cola.

title: India Bombings: Gangs Involved, But Who Else?
description: For nearly two hours on March 12, explosions thundered through this city, sending pillars of black smoke skyward.

title:
DINING OUT;
Ethnic Touches in a Peekskill Kitchen
description: EDUCATORS and sociologists wrangling with the thorny issue of multiculturalism might consider consulting Victoria Zeph, who in her kitchen seems to have resolved the problem. Distinctive international touches -- Thai, South American, Ukrainian, Korean, Jamaican, Chinese and Greek as well as French and Italian -- suggest the great waves of earlier and later immigration. But while the feast she prepares is definitely an American one, what delights and surprises are the infinitely varying and vibrant touches of ethnicity this kitchen employs.

title: Corrections
description: A picture caption on May 2 about bluegrass performers at the 1964 Newport Folk Festival misidentified the musician at the left. He was George Shuffler.

title: Hands Off Baseball? It Has Been Adjusted Before
description: "Two things you don't look for in this game: justice and sympathy."

title: Who Opposes Olympus And Who Would Pay
description: Bruce E. Ferguson's letter [ "Olympus and Financial Ramifications," May 2 ] omits crucial information which prevents your readers from understanding who supports the "Olympus project," who wouldn't, and why. This is not surprising, because the major omission directly involves his own agency, the Suffolk County Industrial Development Agency.

title: Driver Improves
description: The rookie driver ROSS BENTLEY, who suffered first- and second-degree burns to his face, neck and hands when his car caught fire during practice for the Indianapolis 500 on Friday, was listed in good condition yesterday at Methodist Hospital in Indianapolis. He will remain at the hospital at least until today, doctors said.

title: New Shorelines and New Rules to Restrict Hamptons Beachgoers
description: HAMPTONS beachgoers can expect more than the usual trendy changes in beachwear and hot spots this year. Since last summer some shorelines have shifted dramatically, some beaches will be even more difficult to reach, and in other places new rules govern behavior on the sand.

title: An Admitted Long Shot, Gilligan Shows Optimism
description: UNTIL 10 days ago, five candidates were vying for the right to be the Republican nominee for governor in the June 8 primary. In addition to Jim Wallwork, Cary Edwards and Christine Todd Whitman, two other candidates, Charles P. Hoffman of Brick and James Patrick Gilligan of Morris Township, were also busy campaigning.

title: Omaha
description: Omaha, perched on the sensuous, curving bluffs of the Missouri River, has attained a rare urban equilibrium: it is neither too large nor too small. True, its suburbs are sprawling shamelessly west, out onto the prairie. But visitors who hew to the heart of the city -- its downtown, which is coming back after a period of neglect, and its lovely old central-city neighborhoods -- find the perfect tourist equation: plenty to see, do and eat, with few impediments.

title: The Hazards Of Flying Indian Airlines
description: Air travel in India, never very convenient or pleasant, has recently assumed more dangerous proportions, with a spate of hijackings and crashes overshadowing the usual delays, rudeness and lost baggage. In the first four months of 1993 alone, there were two crashes and four hijackings. (There were no incidents of either type in 1992.)

title: Wall Street; A New List of Mutual Fund Underachievers
description: THERE is an opinion wherever you look on which mutual funds are the best. But what about the worst? Stephen Leeb, editor of Personal Finance newsletter, found eight victims for his "Mutual Fund Hall of Shame" a year ago, and the group managed to underperform all the major stock market averages in the 12 months ended Feb. 28.

title: Jane Humpstone, Courtney Ward 3d
description: Mr. and Mrs. John H. Humpstone Jr. of Locust Valley, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter Jane Hamilton Humpstone to L. Courtney Ward 3d, the son of Lee C. Ward Jr. and Barbara Ward, both of New York.

title: Emily Foster, Charles Verbeck
description: Emily Bradstreet Foster, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Douglas Foster of Bronxville, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Charles Anthony Verbeck, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Pieter Verbeck of Darien, Conn. The Rev. P. C. Ennis performed the ceremony at the Reformed Church of Bronxville.

title:
NORTHEAST NOTEBOOK: Stowe, Vt.;
Revamping The Resorts
description: SUMMER completion is expected for the $1 million reconstruction of a lodge that was this Green Mountain resort town's first motel when it was built 40 years ago.

title: An Optimist Despite the Evidence
description: RACE MATTERSBy Cornel West.105 pp. Boston: Beacon Press. $15.

title: The Blessing Of a Desert Land
description: RISING MAJESTICALLY from the desert plain seven miles south of Tucson, Ariz., Mission San Xavier del Bac is the only Chartres this desert land will know. A monolithic white structure, aptly called the White Dove of the Desert, it seems to ascend from the solid earth a living spirit, complete, alive.

title: Venice's Isle of the Dead
description: ALTHOUGH Venice rings, chatters, hums and even sings with life -- its church bells, murmuring pedestrians, churning motorboats and caroling gondoliers are only part of an underlying melody -- it is also a city that compels a visitor to think about death. Looming over the dark, sometimes rank canals, crumbling buildings stand silently with shuttered windows. Empty campielli -- paved squares -- echo eerily during long quiet off-season afternoons. Walking on the Lido, readers who have never opened its pages may think of Thomas Mann's "Death in Venice."

title: Lozano Case Tests How Racially Balanced a Jury Must Be
description: FIRST the Rodney King case, now the trial of William Lozano. Once again, the issues of race and justice, especially as they pertain to the selection and composition of juries, have collided, this time in the case of a suspended Miami policeman whose retrial on manslaughter charges in the deaths of two young black men began here last week after being shifted five times among three Florida cities in a search for a racially and ethnically balanced panel.

title: In the Region: Westchester; Recent Sales
description: Port Chester, N.Y. $175,000 531 Irving Avenue 3-bedroom, 1 1/2-bath, 70-year-old Colonial; dining room, in-law apartment, detached one-car garage; taxes, $4,880. Rye, N.Y. $180,000 35 Park Avenue 3-bedroom, 1 1/2-bath, 73-year-old colonial; enclosed front porch, dining room, detached two-car garage; taxes, $3,068. White Plains, N.Y. $247,000 76 Holland Avenue 5-bedroom, 2 1/2-bath, 62-year-old Tudor; entry hall, sun room, skylights, modern kitchen, finished basement; taxes, $3,700. Hamden, Conn. $170,000 1743 Whitney Avenue 4-bedroom, 1 1/2-bath, 149-year-old colonial; eat-in kitchen, fireplace, built-in shelves, 0.75 acre; taxes, $4,250. title:
Westchester Q&A;: Ruth R. Whitney;
Changing Face of Women's Magazines
description: LOOK at the current issue of Glamour magazine, and you will see that women's magazines have changed. Sure, there are still beautiful models on the covers, beautifully dressed, but look inside: there is a story in Glamour about women owning guns. And Glamour is not alone in this trend toward covering social and political issues. In the current issue of Vogue, another Conde Nast publication, there is a story about Bosnia.

title: Beauty in the New Age
description: "Essence of Beauty," said Carre Otis, tapping one drop out of a slender vial. "Add Royal Jelly, Super Essence, some Shen for balance," and she stirred, smiled, then handed a murkish brown concoction across the counter top. It tasted like dirt.

title: THE GUIDE
description: HYMN FESTIVAL

title: Enter the Clergyman, Handsome and Single
description: LOVING DAUGHTERS By Olga Masters. 319 pp. New York: W. W. Norton & Company. $21.95.

title:
The Executive Life;
Managing Emotions In the Workplace
description: When Bristol-Myers acquired Squibb in 1989, Richard L. Gelb, chairman and chief executive of Bristol-Myers, wanted to minimize the anxieties his newly combined work force would undergo in the transition.

title: Christine Wolff, Robert Schachter
description: Christine Wolff, a daughter of Carole Wolff of Valley Stream, L.I., and Edward Wolff of Oceanside, L.I., was married last evening to Robert Paul Schachter, a son of Martin and Barbara Schachter of Stuart, Fla. Rabbi Sholom Stern officiated at Temple Beth El in Cedarhurst, L.I.

Dadourian of Plandome, L.I., was married there last evening to Steven Carlton Kline, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Kline of Vicksburg, Miss. Rabbi Hava Pell performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents. The Rev. Carnig Hallajian, an Armenian Apostolic priest, took part in the ceremony.
